narrative.fact: Ankur Nagpal was teaching marketing courses on Udemy and wanted direct access to students and sales instead of relying on third-party platforms.
Existing course platforms limited ownership of content, branding, and customer relationships, pushing the founder to seek a tool creators could fully control.
In fall 2013 he locked himself in a room for three days to build a rudimentary site to sell his own mobile marketing course directly.
The first version (Fedora) launched with the founderâ€™s own course and quickly added the first few paying customers, including partner Conrad Wadowski, before the team rebuilt it together.
Teachable reports $10B+ earned by creators, 30M+ products sold, and 21M+ consumers across Teachable and Hotmart with 200K+ creators using the platforms.
Positions itself as a creator-owned platform that bundles courses, coaching, downloads, memberships, community, payments, analytics, and AI tools under one customizable brand experience.
Founded in 2014 in New York; public profile lists 51-200 employees and over 150,000 creators relying on the platform.

story_judgement.reason: Founder-built MVP story is documented, current scale and revenue to creators are reported, and the platform addresses a clear creator ownership pain point.
